page.title: 06EDUCATION.
page.content: The largest school in our area is an independent Catholic boarding school called Stonyhurst College.Boys go to the College aged from 13 to 18 years.The College has a junior school (Preparatory School) called St. Mary's Hall where the boys are from 8 to 13 years old. In the village of Hurst Green there is a Catholic junior school, St.Joseph's.There used to be a Church of England school called St.John's, but this had to close down due to lack of pupils.'Falling Rolls' is the major problem facing village schools. When the children leave St.Joseph's they go to St.Augustine's,a Catholic secondary school in Billington.
